===Etymology===
{{ja-kanjitab|す|yomi=k}}
Unclear.  One theory is that this is a native Japanese term, with the ''su'' reading somehow related to the way that very sour things cause one to pucker.

Given that vinegar was historically introduced to Japan in the 300-400s from China, another possibility is that the ''su'' reading is from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=す}} {{m|zh|酢}} or {{m|zh|醋}} instead, and that this naturalized and came to be regarded as a native [[訓読み|kun'yomi]] rather than a Chinese-derived [[音読み|on'yomi]].  Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading ''cù'' or {{etyl|yue|-}} ''cou<sup>3</sup>''.

====Idioms====
{{der-top|Idioms of {{lang|ja|酢}}}}
* {{ja-r|酢が過ぎる|す が すぎる}}: Doing too much, being excessive.
* {{ja-r|酢でさいて飲む|す で さいて のむ}}: Doing something very simple.
* {{ja-r|酢でも酒塩でも|す で も さかしお で も}}, {{ja-r|酢でも蒟蒻でも|す で も こんにゃく で も}}: {{sense|used with a negative verb}} Something that cannot be done in the usual fashion, or cannot be done easily.
* {{ja-r|酢に当て粉に当て|す に あて こ に あて}}, {{ja-r|酢につけ粉につけ|す に つけ こ に つけ}}: About something, about various things; from time to time.
* {{ja-r|酢にも粉にも|す に も こ に も}}, {{ja-r|酢にも塩にも|す に も しお に も]}}, {{ja-r|酢にも蛸にも|す に も たこ に も}}, {{ja-r|酢にも味噌にも|す に も みそ に も}}: About anything, in anything.
* {{ja-r|酢の粉の|す の こ の}}, {{ja-r|酢の蒟蒻の|す の こんにゃく の}}: Of anything, belonging to anything.
* {{ja-r|酢を買う|す を かう}}, {{ja-r|酢を乞う|す を こ.う}}: To lose [[goodwill]] through excessive [[sycophancy]], to anger someone by saying more than one should; to [[agitate]] or [[instigate]], to stir things up.
{{der-bottom}}
